name: wekan
description: Wekan is an open-source, Trello-like kanban board for managing tasks and projects. It offers boards, lists, cards, swimlanes, and permissions, and can be deployed self-hosted or via various hosted providers for teams of any size.
features: Kanban boards: Organize tasks visually with customizable boards, lists, and cards for project management.
Drag-and-drop: Move cards between lists effortlessly to update task status and workflow progression.
Card details: Add descriptions, checklists, due dates, attachments, and comments to cards for comprehensive task tracking.
Swimlanes: Group cards horizontally by assignee, priority, or custom criteria for better organization.
Labels and tags: Categorize cards with color-coded labels for quick visual identification of task types.
Team collaboration: Assign cards to team members, mention users in comments, and track who's working on what.
Board templates: Create reusable board templates for recurring projects or standardized workflows.
Calendar view: Visualize tasks with due dates in a calendar format for deadline management.
Activity tracking: Monitor all board changes with detailed activity logs showing who did what and when.
Custom fields: Add custom data fields to cards for tracking project-specific information.
Import/export: Migrate boards from Trello or export data in JSON format for backup or analysis.
Access control: Set board permissions to control who can view, edit, or administer specific boards.
